channel.title: Wireline Technology on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Wireline Technology on 0x000216

item.title: Can Wireless Broadband Displace DSL and Cable?
item.description: Wired technologies, like DSL and Cable for consumers and T1 lines for businesses, have allowed broadband to replace dial-up internet access. However, a new competitor, wireless technology, could potentially disrupt wireline broadband just as it did to dial-up. While Wireless Internet Service Providers (WISPs) have existed for years, their limited coverage and small service areas haven’t posed a significant threat to telephone or cable companies. Business wireless internet remains mostly in major city centers, while consumer wireless targets rural areas beyond the reach of DSL and cable.
